greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of n-block r-bicoverings.
comment: A bicovering is an r-bicovering if the intersection of every two blocks contains at most one element.
reference: I. P. Goulden and D. M. Jackson, Combinatorial Enumeration, John Wiley and Sons, N.Y., 1983.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..30
formula: E.g.f. for number of n-block r-bicoverings of a k-set is exp(-x-1/2*x^2*y)*Sum_{i=0..inf} (1+y)^binomial(i, 2)*x^i/i!.
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 15 2001
ext: Terms a(11) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Jan 30 2020
